title: Pride of Britain Awards: Emily Atack wears low-cut black gown
text:
She recently unveiled her new brunette hairdo weeks after her split from boyfriend Rob Jowers.

And Emily Atack looked stunning as she continued to showcase her darker locks as she graced the red carpet at the 2019 Pride of Britain Awards at the Grosvenor House Hotel in London on Monday.

The I'm A Celebrity star, 29, put on a very racy display as she flaunted her cleavage in a black strapless black gown.

Wow: Emily Atack continued to showcase her darker locks as she graced the red carpet at the 2019 Pride of Britain Awards at the Grosvenor House Hotel in London on Monday

Oozing confidence, Emily looked sensational in the fitted number which featured a dramatic scoop neckline which drew emphasis to her ample assets.

Allowing the gown to do all the talking, the TV personality ditched the accessories save for a pair of dazzling silver drop earrings.

Emily added a glam layer of make-up to her face while her brunette tresses were styled into chic Hollywood waves.

The star later met up with her friend and fellow I'm A Celebrity pal Nick Knowles, who looked dapper in a navy suit.

Stunning: The I'm A Celebrity star, 29, put on a very racy display as she flaunted her cleavage in a black strapless black gown

Busty display: Oozing confidence, Emily looked sensational in the fitted number which featured a dramatic scoop neckline which drew emphasis to her ample assets

The pair were delighted to see each other as they warmly hugged amid the fun night out.

The star is preparing to head back to Australia as one of the new hosts of I'm A Celeb spin-off, Extra Camp.

Speaking exclusively to MailOnline to at the awards she said: 'I’m so excited just going back somewhere that changed my life completely. I can’t wait.

'I’d have been heartbroken if I didn’t have anything to do with it this year. I’d have been so jealous watching everybody going in. I was the luckiest in the world to have the people I have, I hope the people that do it this year are as lucky as I was.'

More than 100 of the UK's biggest stars will come together at the Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards to honour the nation's unsung heroes on the landmark 20th anniversary of the event.

The awards recognise and celebrate ordinary people up and down the country doing extraordinary things.

Hosted by Carol Vorderman, celebrities and public figures including Prince Charles, Robert Downey Jr, Sir Ben Kingsley, Dua Lipa, Ant & Dec, Chris Pratt, Michael Sheen, Adam Lambert, Christine Lampard, Sir Michael Caine, Jonathan Ross, Suranne Jones, and the judges and casts of Strictly Come Dancing and X Factor will be honouring this year's awe-inspiring winners.

Finishing touches: Allowing the gown to do all the talking, the TV personality ditched the accessories save for a pair of dazzling silver drop earrings

So chic: Emily added a glam layer of make-up to her face while her brunette tresses were styled into chic Hollywood waves

Night out: Emily hoisted up her gown as she walked the red carpet at London's Grosvenor House Hotel

Carol Vorderman said: 'Pride of Britain is such a huge part of my life, it's hard to believe it's 20 years since we first started. In that time, it has found a place at the heart of British life, and the winners represent the very best of us. I never fail to be humbled by them, and this year's are no different.'

Emily's appearance comes after she parted ways from her film producer boyfriend Rob after a six-month romance, and she has taken the split hard.

Last week, she broke her silence about the break-up in an interview with OK! magazine as she said she had hoped he was her 'happy ending.'

Hey there: The star later met up with her friend and fellow I'm A Celebrity pal Nick Knowles, who looked dapper in a navy suit

So close: The pair were delighted to see each other as they warmly hugged amid the fun night out

She said: 'It's been a very, very tough time and it's still very raw. Luckily, I've got so many things happening in my life to distract me from the fact I'm incredibly sad.

'But I know the drill and I've got over boys before. Heartbreak gets harder to deal with as you get older as you pin your hopes on things. I so wanted this to be my happy ending.'

Emily is releasing a new book called Are We There Yet? in which she talks about her life so far.

Heartbreak makeover: Emily recently parted ways from her boyfriend Rob Jowers after a six-month romance, and has taken the split hard

Before and after: The star (pictured left in May 2019) looked dramatically different after her sophisticated makeover (pictured right)

And she's searingly honest about her battles with depression and admits to using alcohol and anti-depressants during her darkest moments - she is now medication free.

She said: 'I used medication to get me out of bed in the morning during an incredibly tough time and to dry up my tears, but I'm not in that place anymore.'

Emily admitted to being on medication for three years on the advice of her doctor rather than her therapist.

She insists she feels 'stronger now' and ready for what life throws at her but notes that often the people who seem most bubbly are battling the biggest internal struggles.
